revised_title: Receptivity of Görtler Vortices in Boundary Layer Flows
tldr: This study investigates the receptivity problem for Görtler vortices in boundary layer flows, focusing on the effects of wall roughness and distributed forcing. The authors analyze the flow structure using an analytical technique and Laplace transform solutions, finding that wall roughness is inefficient in stimulating small wavelength Görtler vortices. They also demonstrate that the initial conditions for numerical solutions need to be amended, providing new insights into the development of vortices in boundary layer flows.
